website_summaries.verdict: Packing a surprising amount of processing power for the price, this laptop is a bargain for workplace professionals.
cons: Its maximum volume fails to impress

customer_reviews.title: 4gb memory when it says 8gb
customer_reviews.text: With respect to the aspect everything is perfect for the cost, the only problem is that I wanted to check the memory and it turns out that it came with a 4GB and the description says of 8GB I am disappointed in this. since one trusts what they are selling. You should not have to check if this was true.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Contreras

customer_reviews.title: Please dont buy if you do any visual work. Fake screen
customer_reviews.text: I was angry of seeing this kind of fake like screen. Description says it is 178view angle. 178 is ips screen. This one has 20degree view angle i saw in 1997. Maybe it is a fake laptop or screen replaced. This screen extinct in 21st century. You cannot figure out what color is it that that you are seeing on the screen. NOT AT ALL. Screen brightness change even if you move slightly. No matter what distance between 5” ~3ft. It is that bad. NO matter how you see, top and bottom of the screen have different color and brightness.
customer_reviews.author: Electric imaging equipment designer.

customer_reviews.title: Awful Screen
customer_reviews.text: The screen quality ruins this. Washed out and gray at every angle. Absolutely terrible
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: Advertised USB-C connectivity just for namesake
customer_reviews.text: Screen is not the best but still workable and understandable at this price point. But this laptop gets filtered up in search while looking for USB-C connectivity, which in my opinion is a great way to reduce cable clutter and inconvenience associated with keeping chargers and display cables. But this laptop does not offer any of those functions through USB-C. Then what's the point of advertising and having USB-C.
customer_reviews.author: Nitin

customer_reviews.title: Worst buy ever
customer_reviews.text: The worst brand new laptop computer I have ever purchased. Screen quality is so so. Can’t run simple games without lagging out.. audio isn’t even relevant. Can’t hear it at all on 100% volume. Audio jack stopped working on the 5th day. Mouse touchpad stopped working after a week. Just bad bad bad. Spend a hundred more on something worth while. Never again
customer_reviews.author: K Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Must have been defective!
customer_reviews.text: My husbands 15 yr old Lenovo finally died and I wanted to buy him an Acer like I purchased several months ago, but due to the Coronavirus there were very few laptops to choose from...no Acers like mine left! So I bought this thing and it would not even let me set it up. Four times we tried, waiting for a few hours to get it to work.....nothing! I’ve had many, many laptops and computers and never had anything like this, so sent it back next day. I hope no one else gets this one sent to them! I hope my next choice works better
customer_reviews.author: Lee WagarTop Contributor: Watercolor Painting

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this. Faulty product!
customer_reviews.text: The screen had an issue where it wouldn’t load properly and glitches out often. I called ASUS tech support and talked with them for two hours to try and fix the display problem with no positive results. I’m horribly disappointed because I needed this for school and now I have to return it and find a new laptop while I’m supposed to be working on my classes. I would never buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: The speakers and screen quality are TERRIBLE. The speakers are on the bottom, which makes NO sense. No matter which surface I set the laptop on, the audio was low and muffled. The angles on the screen are also awful, as you can only really see the picture if you're looking straight on. I did like the keyboard better than others, and also liked the backlit keyboard. But I ended up returning this due to how annoying and awful the audio and screen quality is.
customer_reviews.author: MaliB

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Screen Straining Eyes
customer_reviews.text: The laptop screen is absolutely horrible. The whites are this odd yellow color. I have to imagine my screen is messed up, but other reviews agree the screen is trash. I have an old Dell laptop for work that has a much brighter screen. All that and I must say the speakers are of poor quality. If there is any bass they sound so bad. The speakers are also underneath the keyboard, so if you want to sit with your LAPtop in your LAP and listen to music, think again. If I could return it, I absolutely would. Unfortunately it seems as though amazon's return policy doesn't cover poorly made laptops.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: screen needs upgrade
customer_reviews.text: CPU: Great works quickly Ram: 8gb works quickly Best budget laptop hands down.... The screen though is pure garbage. viewing angles are horrible and the panel is just gray.... idk how to explain it but yeah.... it sucks but for $400 you aren't going to find a better laptop so 5 stars for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Del Santana

customer_reviews.title: Great budget laptop for high schooler
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter who is in high school. I was very pleasantly surprised by the performance of this budget laptop. She uses flash based educational programs, watches YouTube and checks her gmail. No bloatware installed and it comes with 1 year of accidental damage when you register it. She loves the fingerprint reader, wide screen and the backlit keyboard. The camera is acceptable for video chatting and includes an led light when it is on. The chassis was surprisingly stiff for a budget laptop and the keyboard had acceptable feedback and feel. The screen quality isn't the best, but for a budget laptop, it is livable.
customer_reviews.author: Florida MTBer

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, but beware windows one drive
customer_reviews.text: This is a great laptop for me as a student. However during initial install it asked if you want to use the free 5 Gigs of storage with Microsoft one drive. This is not a backup it stores your files on the cloud drive only.
customer_reviews.author: randy westover

customer_reviews.title: Everything works perfectly with Linux
customer_reviews.text: This hardware is highly compatible with Linux. I am using Arch on this, and everything works out of the box --- no special drivers were needed. It seems to be reasonably fast, and the only downside for me is the screen brightness. While I think it is sharp enough, it is less bright than I care for. (However, others that used this screen find it more to their taste in terms of brightness, so this is very much a matter of opinion rather than fact.) The real pleasure here of course the price; a 15.6 screen, 128 gigabyte SSD, an I3 processor, and 8 gigabytes of memory are quite good specs for a $400 machine.
customer_reviews.author: pen name

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking!!
customer_reviews.text: What a disappointment. I was so excited to get my new laptop. The screen quality is aweful..graying out if I even shift a bit in my seat. The touch pad was wonky..jerky and not responsive at all, at times. But the real kicker was the volume...or lack thereof. At the highest setting we could barely hear it. So I tried eatbuds. They were even worse. If i held them crammed into my ear I could faintly hear. Just aweful all around. It is boxed and ready to be picked up for return. I have already ordered a replacement...not the same model obviously..fingers crossed!!
customer_reviews.author: nanatude

customer_reviews.title: Backlit Keyboard Not Working
customer_reviews.text: Laptop works fine, but the keyboard light is turning on for mine!
customer_reviews.author: Renaine Aliwalas

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with this laptop. I needed a cheap quality laptop to check emails and browse the web. Here lately I've been recruited to play Minecraft with my kids and this laptop is more than capable of handling a hour or so long session. Sure there are faster laptops, but this works for me and the price was right.
customer_reviews.author: Oregonbob

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my niece. My only complaint is the keyboard. The keys are not great, but everything else about this laptop is dope. I like it so much that I'll consider it for my next replacement laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Persona

customer_reviews.title: Great for working from home
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I bought it to work from home beside the reviews were good. I’m not computer savvy but it handles my work from home program well. I’m able to plug my headset, an regular keyboard and a second screen onto it. I found that I can work on it w/ multiple programs running from 7am-11am without the charger; so a good 4 hours of battery life... one day I let it go past 11 am and ran out of battery right in the middle or working. I ran and plugged it in and got it back up and running; no biggie.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Thao

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the performance, but some MAJOR drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: Pros: For the money, this is one of the best performing PCs. It can handle large Excel documents just fine, and runs most games with ease. On paper, it can't be beat. Unfortunately . . . Cons: Absolutely abysmal battery life. Full charge will get you 3 hours just browsing online. That number dwindles with more intense tasks. Additionally, the screen is not great. It seems no matter the viewing angle, you get odd highlights/shadows on the screen. Takeaway: I was trying to find a nice budget laptop. This one performs great, but I wish I had spent an extra $100 on something that was more comfortable and convenient to use.
customer_reviews.author: Keaton Post

customer_reviews.title: Recieved broken laptop
customer_reviews.text: I guess if you dont buy an insurance policy they send you a faulty product on purpose. I never took it out of my room. Only used it to watch videos, search a few web pages, and attempt to play the yousician app. Which only worked once. In two months of minor usage it has stopped turning on. And it had only taken a week before sound quality diminished. Loading slowed. Charging slowed. And now this. Beyond furious
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Greenslade

customer_reviews.title: Decent Laptop
customer_reviews.text: Construction feels solid. Lightweight but sturdy and thin profile. Not the world's best screen but manageable unless you're obsessed with HD. The number pad on the right of the keyboard is virtually useless, as it doesn't follow traditional keypad format. The rest of the keyboard is great and a joy to type on. Very responsive, and takes all of five seconds to remove the pre-installed Microsoft S for normal Windows 10. All and all, well worth the $400. It's not going to set any records but it will handle 90% of population's needs.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Goldsmith

customer_reviews.title: Really good laptop for the price
customer_reviews.text: The laptop is really fast due to ssd m.2 drive and 8gb ddr4 ram. I did not notice any screen quality issues, as for me the screen is good enough. Approximately 80 gb of space is available ( other space is occupied by windows) so making a little upgrade like installing additional ssd would be a good idea. The sound is not very loud, but sufficient for watching movies. To Sum up: Weaknesses Sound ( slightly) Memory ( upgrade needed) Strengths Thin, lightweight, fast, price Overall-good laptop for business and personal needs (not gaming), and even weaknesses do not seem critical, considering the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop for all day use!
customer_reviews.text: Had this for almost a year. Didn't want to write anything till I had it for awhile. The battery is decent. The screen could be a bit better for the price. Gaming is okay for lower bit games, definitely not for not apex or anything. Dota 2 and CSGO are good. Gotta lower the graphics for CSGO though. I've also been becoming a content creator and it runs the software greatly! All around a good laptop for everyday use for sure!😄
customer_reviews.author: Lars McFarland

customer_reviews.title: ASUS very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Recently bought this laptop and discovered they failed to install the driver for the webcam. Spent 2.5 hours (first two techs were useless an I had to escalate to supervisor) on the phone with tech support and they insisted the only way to fix was to send my laptop in for about a 2 week turnaround time or do a reset where I'd lose all the software and files I have loaded. I wasn't willing to do either and asked for them to send me an external webcam which of course they refused. So I must now buy an external webcam all due to Asus' very poor quality assurance during their software/driver loading during the manufacturing process.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for average computer users
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 of these for my parents for Christmas. These are not meant for gaming (obviously) but I did manage to stream on Netflix and scroll Facebook and have Spotify going all at once, just as a performance test and these things are awesome for that. Sound quality isn’t terrific since the speakers are on the bottom side but it gets the job done. It’s affordable, reliable and ASUS is a solid brand too. Would recommend this to anyone who needs a laptop for school or work related stuff.
customer_reviews.author: BMass

customer_reviews.title: Not too much, not too little, but just right
customer_reviews.text: As many before me have said, this is a terrific computer. I returned two computers with a faster processor and more RAM. They simply ran too hot and had fans come on quickly. This Asus has a very good processor and sufficient RAM, but it runs quietly with a solid battery life. It boots in less than 5 seconds for me, and it's speed isn't affected much by my VPN service and other processor chokers. Asus gives you some nice benefits, like the Audio Wizard 10 band equalizer. The backlit keys go off after a bit to conserve power. For the money, just an awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Noonan

customer_reviews.title: Overall it's okay for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It’s almost okay. But one of the the downsides is its screen quality. The viewing angle is below average and the color is not that good. Another downside is heating. It heated up very quickly while on change and at the same time you use the internet. But if you buy this laptop for day to day tasks like web browsing, watching videos, doing homework or some office tasks then it's okay and fast enough. Build quality and design is awesome and stylish. Battery life is average, like 3.5/4 hours while using internet. But it takes very small amount of time for charging. After all, I'm not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Soumique Khan

customer_reviews.title: Great Laptop
customer_reviews.text: My son and I agreed to purchase a laptop for his use in his online classes. After some significant research we decided on this laptop. My son loves it. He says it is fast, clear screen, and he loves the backlit keyboard! He started his classes a few weeks ago, and enjoys its quick speed as he searches the internet for the information that he needs to find. If we needed another smaller laptop we would certainly buy the newest model of this computer!
customer_reviews.author: katsign

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life Not Great - But Good Laptop for the Price
customer_reviews.text: As my title says - the battery power needs a ton of improvement. My 6 year old $200 ASUS netbook had a longer battery life, but it broke it half so I needed to buy something quickly. My netbook had flung off of the roof of my car on the highway two years ago and SURVIVED without any operational damage, so I wanted to stick with the brand. I really wish the S mode wasn't a thing. Editing to add that the volume is also pretty poor. Can't hear any streaming well. Spotify is better but still underwhelmed for the year of release, price, and brand.
customer_reviews.author: gnoxis

customer_reviews.title: Great for what it is
customer_reviews.text: Step one, leave Windows 10 S Mode. Step two, replace 4GB RAM (second 4GB RAM is soldered in) with a 16GB RAM module. Step three, replace 128GB SSD with a Samsung EVO 970. I am only using this laptop for cloud maintenance and RDP/SSH/VNC connectivity. Perfect for that! My only complaint is the screen brightness doesn't measure up to other models and contrast isn't great. Otherwise perfect for light work and portable media (for the non-picky).
customer_reviews.author: Chace Cade

customer_reviews.title: extremely poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: does not come with an ethernet link. hours on the phone trying to figure out if an adapter would give me a landline, as i detest wifi. no one there with any real knowledge. bought usb ethernet adaptor, only to find that didn't work either, on the asus or another computer. i haven't returned it yet, though 48 hours later it has been nothing but a waste of time so far. after a few days of calling and emailing, i was advised by one online tech that the product cannot be used with a landline, while another emailing me provided me with a link to a $160+ adaptor that would supposedly allow landline access.
customer_reviews.author: glen r broemer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent features for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this laptop for my nephew, I would consider buying one for myself (With a core I5): Pros Excellent for Price/Quality 8 Gigs of memory Display is bright and clear Good processor Backlit keyboard Fingerprint reader Good camera for Zoom/Skype/etc Cons Only 128 gigs of Storage (Nah, just buy it and get extra storage, it worth the upgrade) Buy it for Office tasks Web browsing Web development Don't buy it for Playing AAA games Video editing tasks
customer_reviews.author: Washington I.

customer_reviews.title: s mode issues updated
customer_reviews.text: couldnt download google chrome because of s mode followed directions to get out of s mode and found out there were errors updating the computer itself so back it goes DONFT BUY PCS WITH S MODE So I am changing this review I had an uninformed tech who didn't help at all. I was ready to send this back and I looked online factory reset the computer and was able to take it out of s mode but note if you do this you cant up it back
customer_reviews.author: DanceFlixMusic

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent laptop! Sound quality is awesome and easily adjustable with the stock Audio Wizard program that it comes with. Screen is bright and big. Great for gaming. Great for school. Quick fingerprint access reader. Voice commands! Lots of good free apps available for it. I love everything about this lap top so far. Great low price! No issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: TANYA L. SCARPIELLO

customer_reviews.title: PC Rules it all!!!!
customer_reviews.text: A nice budget friendly and basic laptop for average typical needs. Not great for gaming it does not have the power to handle a high end of capabilities but it's great for everything else. Easy to install and update. Light and nice material used.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffy

customer_reviews.title: Has 8gb of memory contrary to uneducated reviews
customer_reviews.text: If you don't know anything about computers, don't write a review speaking about specs. This computer has the 8gb of memory as stated. 4gb on board, 4gb on a stick. That adds up to 8 I think. Snappy little computer. Got it for my 9 year old to do his zoom stuff for school. Thanks libs. Don't expect it to blow you out of the water, but more than capable at a price point that doesn't hurt. Highly recommend. This is my first anything but an HP laptop. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: The Chisholms

customer_reviews.title: I'm not satisfied with the laptop
customer_reviews.text: I like Asus, but this low-class model is not the case. It is already a year I use Asus vivobook 150 s530 Although the screen is Full HD, it is not IPS, which is very bad. The sound has a buzz above 60%. The sound of cooling fan is very loud. It is definitely impossible to open the laptop with one hand. Its edge2edge screen is very beautiful, it is lightweight. the keyboard and touchpad is quite good.
customer_reviews.author: Armen

customer_reviews.title: crazy happy so far!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new laptop because Microsoft discontinued support for window 7. My Dell was a dinosaur. I got it used and had it almost 6 years. this one starts up instantly. wow. people complain these inexpensive laptops are slow. compared to the old one...heck, no! I have no complaints but then again, my needs are few and simple. also, I did research and this laptop made the top ten for the price. no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: A. Pires

customer_reviews.title: Great quality laptop for a fantastic price!
customer_reviews.text: After doing some research I decided to go with this Asas Vivobook. I am so glad I purchased this laptop, needed something for my daughter’s online college courses. Easy to set-up and use, also able to use her wireless Bluetooth headphone. love the visual color display. Keyboard feels good and is very responsive. I have a fingerprint scanner for easy access to all password sites. The processor is very fast and there is no delay loading video or web pages. I highly recommend this laptop for similar use.
customer_reviews.author: james Litterio

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I'm extremely happy with this device. I love having an SSD because it just runs so fast and quiet. At $400, it's a great model. Some people have complained about the screen brightness, but at least for me, it's not at all an issue. Note that I just wanted a basic model to run with Linux, and it works great right out of the box (no wifi issues, recognizes backlit keyboard, every peripheral works). You'll want to turn off secure boot and change SATA to AHCI, and you'll want to optimize Linux for an SSD drive. It's a great Linux machine.
customer_reviews.author: PT

customer_reviews.title: Be aware of usb-c port
customer_reviews.text: Just got my new VivoBook today and getting setup was fast and easy. However, as another reviewer mentioned, the usb-c is for namesake. In my case it is faulty (I think) and I was relying on that port to connect with multiple display monitors. It failed to work with the multiple adapters that have worked fine on my Dell XPS13 (thunderbolt). As a workaround, ended up using the other USB 3.x port to connect via HDMI adapter. Otherwise, overall it is fast and light .. can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: CA_resident

customer_reviews.title: Great PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: I was starting online classes and I figured its time for an upgrade! After much deliberation I decided to go with this product. I have never used ASUS products before , I've always had DELL laptops (which were all great btw). Even though I haven't had this laptop very long so far its pretty fricken amazing!!! 😊The screen quality .... awesome! The keyboard efficiency and lighting ... awesome! The speed...awesome! All I have to say is I will do my best to take very good care of this laptop both physically and performance wise and hopefully it will keep being ...awesome! HIGHLY recommend!!!🥰
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: Rather Good
customer_reviews.text: It's aesthetically pleasing and it's thin build and design reminds me of MacBook air. The system is rather fast and responsive and the display is awesome. I don't know why so many people are complaining about the screen. If you want higher quality, shell out the cash for a more expensive laptop. My only hangup with my Vivobook, is that the sound is a bit muffled if you're using it in bed. But I ordered a Bluetooth speaker which will remedy that. I would definitely reccomend this to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Brian L.

customer_reviews.title: I love you Asus but WHY! :(
customer_reviews.text: For what I paid, it is horrible! This is the worst screen I saw in a laptop. Compared to the Lenovo one I bought for a cousin in need, it had better screen looking compared to this and it is way cheaper. I am disappointed with this laptop. Not worth the price I paid for this... :'(
customer_reviews.author: Diego Luna

customer_reviews.title: Unimpressive and Mediocre
customer_reviews.text: Unimpressive, not worth the price. The screen is terrible. No matter how you look at, there is always a glare. Also a little bit fuzzy, not crisp and clear. The speakers are awful. At 100%, you can hardly hear anything. Battery life is not great, lasted me about 5 hours with continuous use doing basic tasks like web surfing and typing. Webcam is mediocre, nothing special about it. Computer itself is plastic and feels fragile. Not worth $600.
customer_reviews.author: Ashleylynn596

customer_reviews.title: Had to return
customer_reviews.text: Don't know if it was just mine but the very 1st day the screen started fizzing up and continued so I'll just have to return it and maybe go with something more familiar like hp or dell.
customer_reviews.author: AP18

customer_reviews.title: Worst Laptop I Ever Bought
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and thought it would be good, but its really not worth the $500+ spent on it. It isn't good with multitasking and for a few months I gave up Sims 4 but while I was re-downloading everything for it, my computer froze so many times I thought it was going to have a short life. Wish I could sell it back but know I won't get close to the amount I paid. Sadly I can't afford another computer. Next time I'm just going to stick with a brand I'm familiar with and trust.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Yamamoto

customer_reviews.title: fast computer, but speaker is awful
customer_reviews.text: The resolution is weird its like if you get the angle just right its ok, but don't move or its gone. The speaker is worthless. I can't hear my zoom calls. I had to buy an external speaker. It is super fast, though. That's the only reason I didn't return it.
customer_reviews.author: Tina H

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop
customer_reviews.text: I do have a lot of open screens, I didn't need storage or video editing at all, I did need a fast enough computer so I can multi task, this has been an excellent selections, works just great, I'm using two screens, I connected an LG computer screen and just there is when you can see a difference on the ... I wouldn't say quality, but color of the screen, on the lap top is more to the sepia tone, like in reading mode, but for that price and all the rest of the lap top specs it's just excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Jehú Hernández Morón

customer_reviews.title: Just 1 1/2 month and the webcam is not working correctly!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second asus laptop bought on amazon; the first one has 7 years and its working just fine! This one, in a little bit more than a month and the webcam stops working correctly. Amazon’s Customer service wasnt helpful and refer me to conctact Asus directly. I am so disapointed because I always prefer Amazon over ebay because I think its safer but this wasnt the case.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Gaspar César Toledo

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Experience
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for 2 months, THEN, I started getting white screens, called Amazon, they would not refund my entire payment, talked to company where it had come from, they woudn't do anything about it. Talked to ASUS, they were terrible to deal with. I rerturned the product and lost money. This was a faulty product and I lost money, no more ASUS product for this guy.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Dye

customer_reviews.title: Light-weighted, but too much noise
customer_reviews.text: Pro: light-weighted Con: fan blows all the time even the CPU usage is only 10%. I used an ASUS laptop a few years ago in my working company. It was quiet and light so I decided to buy this one for my home office. But I am disappointed by the fact that it is very noisy. The fan runs every minute. If it is quiet, I would give it 5 stars. But unfortunately, I can only give it 3 stars. (Updated on 9/11/2020: Raise it to 4 stars since the laptop is much quiet after I configured Windows to go to hibernate when I close the lid. This reduced the base temporature when I do not use the laptop)
customer_reviews.author: JohnZ

customer_reviews.title: Light smooth and does the job.
customer_reviews.text: One of the best things I like about this laptop is it's keyboard. The keys are very responsives and where other designs like to get "creative" with where they place the backspace, delete button etc. ASUS stuck to the basics and then added room for more without it feeling like there was way too much going on. The battery last about 4 hours with me running Photoshop & Illustration and It also performs well while their software are running. It is not perfect for Adobe but this laptop is way better than some of the other low end laptops I have used before.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Wow !!! Much than than Expected !!!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect so much in a small, light and powerful unit. I am very impressed with all the features on this laptop. From the nano screen, fingerprint reader and (what I admire the most), the backlit keyboard, it far exceeded my expectations. I have heard all the talk about SSD, I will never buy a system with HDD again as my primary boot !!! It blows my mind, how almost instant restarts, updates, multi-tasks and out of sleep this unit does !!! ASUS truly "showed out" on this one !!!
customer_reviews.author: DJ_LILES_NC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this brand of laptop for years, so I picked this brand again. It's perfect for everyday use and both of them fired right up. The only thing I didn't notice at first was that it does not take a standard size chip...only the small ones. We bought a large chip for our camera that has a small, removable chip, and that solved the problem. I LOVE the keyboard lighting up, as my home work space is a bit dark in the morning. Still loving ASUS!
customer_reviews.author: dkj

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT a gaming Laptop
customer_reviews.text: So don't expect it to run Games at 60fps and such. This laptop is nice and small to carry everyday to work for some small presentations and school work. Wife is a nursing student and her last Asus dropped and broke. So we decided to get this one and it works great for her needs and exceeds for that purpose. As long as it last a couple of years, its money well spent for me.
customer_reviews.author: Zo

customer_reviews.title: A mixed bag
customer_reviews.text: A very okay machine. I bought this laptop for writing and the R and S keys started popping off after one (1) week of daily use. The screen is clear for most web browsing but the text appears blurry when the fonts are small, which is difficult for word processing. Decent battery life, so far. I don’t regret my purchase, but I’ve had to buy some accessories to deal with the shortcomings of this laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Sam R

customer_reviews.title: Fast, Simple, and Effective
customer_reviews.text: I am a teacher in North Texas, and with Covid, my technological needs changed. In comes this laptop. It has plenty of RAM to multitask and a strong processor. There is very little lag, even when on a ZOOM call with 200 other teachers. I like the feel of the keyboard too--Large and easy to use. This laptop was 400 bucks when I bought it, which is a steal for a laptop with these specs.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Great insides, poor screen
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my fiance as he needed something mobile to use. Amazing hardware for the price. The screen is what they get you with. If you have a good viewing angle and are not used to looking at high quality desktop monitors or 4k tv screens you shouldn't notice it too much. This isn't made for gaming or watching movies with stunning color and crispness so do not expect that. I would recommended it more for its ability to do all the other things you would want from a laptop but you still have enough screen quality to not feel like you're watching an old tube tv from the 70s.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Ross

customer_reviews.title: Like many others say, screen quality is inexcusable
customer_reviews.text: This is something you'll notice the second you open up your laptop, it looks just like the ones we had to use in school! the crappy $50 DoE laptops and yet this is a $400 laptop. It is inexcusable and the glare is so bad that any other benefits of this laptop are thrown out the window. There is a reason why they don't talk about their display technology for this model in depth. That's because its just not IPS. If you're looking for a laptop you have to make sure they have IPS displays, its 2020 there should be no other option!
customer_reviews.author: Rene

customer_reviews.title: Solid basic computer.
customer_reviews.text: I was once a MacBook user but after paying all of that money for them to break after a few years, I went with something cheaper that I can use for light use. It’s only use is for work. It is fast enough, has a solid battery, and the screen quality is nice. I’ve been using it for over a month and I’m really enjoying it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi S.

customer_reviews.title: Technical issues
customer_reviews.text: This computer gave me problems with certain websites and features. The Adobe Flash kept acting up; I could not download any MP3 files, or anything for that matter, that is not part of the Microsoft family. I started getting a lot of spam emails, once I created a Microsoft account. The keyboard is super sensitive and the mousepad had no right or left button. I had to do a lot of fishing around to find out how to use features...comes with no manual. When I contacted Amazon to get support, the person gave me no options other than returning the laptop, which is what I did.
customer_reviews.author: RICH

customer_reviews.title: Non-existent customer service
customer_reviews.text: Had the laptop for 3 months. It soon started to drop the internet. Checked all of the settings. All OK. Still dropping internet. No other laptop or internet devices in home have a problem with this. Went to Asus website. YOU CANNOT SPEAK TO ANYONE. SCROLL MENUE only. If your problem is not on list you are screwed. Pop-up asks if you want to "live chat" When you click it, it sends you to another loop and you go round and round and round. No help. Will take to a computer shop. ASUS warranty is worthless. Everyone blaming bad service or no service these days on Corona.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Loving it so far. Pretty fast. Nice functions and compact. For the price it’s a good buy. I would recommend to students, small business and overall everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: GM

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for someome who'll use it strictly for email and YouTube, but honestly I'm shocked by how good this laptop is! Everything is very responsive and I love the setup. Great laptop!
customer_reviews.author: Renee Garmany

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop overall
customer_reviews.text: Great laptop overall, especially for the price. The battery life seems a bit inconsistent and the speakers aren't very powerful, which is why I knocked a star off. Otherwise, though, it's light, fast, and performs consistently. I bought it two months ago and use it mainly for work (browsing the web/Microsoft Office/Acrobat).
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Rusick

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop
customer_reviews.text: Bought this laptop for my child for virtual school and it came in faster than expected. Battery doesn’t last long but it is perfect for his school. Big screen, camera is ok not the clearest but works good enough. More than enough memory/space. Easy keyboard and other cool features. Light weight and sleek. Would definitely recommend this laptop.
customer_reviews.author: BMA

customer_reviews.title: wisest move i ever made
customer_reviews.text: this computer runs great out of s mode. with of course a virus protection. the backlight key board the smoothness of typing keypad. the quality of this note book is well made. the speedy delievery of course. good grade of speed. i didn't need a big hard drive but did give a sizeable amount. now i got my son to buy one.
customer_reviews.author: debbie a durivou

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Laptop
customer_reviews.text: For $400 this laptop is not worth it. I can’t go 5 minutes without it crashing and I need this for school and work. I can never get anything done with it and I’ve barely had it a couple months. If there was a way I could fix the crashing issue without spending any for money this would be a 5 star laptop for me but it isn’t. I thought if I were to wait it out it would get better but it hasn’t and now I’m stuck with this piece of junk and out $400. And for a college student that is a lot of money to be throwing away.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson Clark

customer_reviews.title: Fast and efficient.
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews before I bought this, I didn't want to spend near a thousand. This was closer to the budget I had to expend, had the right speed and memory for my job so I bought it. I've had it since Nov 2019 and it works well. I use it for work, I'm in business finance, so not doing lots of Media stuff but I do need storage and speed. This is a great purchase for the price so far.
customer_reviews.author: California girl living in NY

customer_reviews.title: Good Computer for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good little computer for the price. We use it for our small business for work/ emails, office documents, etc. It does everything we need. This is our second one to purchase and we have had no issues. The only point to note is that the USB-C is for data transfer only. We wanted to add 2 monitors to it but unable to connect a USB- C to HDMI. We were able to work around this problem with a USB 3.0 to HDMI converter and it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Apparently got a used unit
customer_reviews.text: After opening and getting the unit to good light noticed that there were bumps and scraches all over the case. See the pictures and be alert when you buy.
customer_reviews.author: EdV

customer_reviews.title: Junk in 5 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this laptop in December of 2019 as a Christmas present for my daughter, 5 months later the laptop doesnt even turn on. Now with the pandemic situation, it's been a challenge to get any assistance online through Asus.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Caballero

customer_reviews.title: Probably fine Computer...Speakers quite and poor
customer_reviews.text: Just got the computer last night. Seems pretty good besides one small, but very often used feature: the speakers. They're so quite and so poor. If you've ever got a keychain bluetooth speaker as a RiteAid impulse buy for $8, you've gotten better sound than this computer. Ugh... is deleting all my already imputed info, then boxing it up, printing a label, and shipping it back worth the lack of speaker quality... Just maybe!!
customer_reviews.author: joshua E. johnson

customer_reviews.title: the power button is wanky
customer_reviews.text: This is my onlt computer, since I ruined my old one. Its slim and light, good battery life, BUT turning it on is not easy. I may have to hold the button down for several minutes before it lights up, and this is a problem. Its a good value, for the lowest price, and delivery was fast.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: GREAT LITTLE LAPTOP AT A VERY REASONABLE PRICE.
customer_reviews.text: SO FAR, THIS LAPTOP HAS PERFORMED BEAUTIFULLY. IT'S QUITE FAST AND IS EASY TO HANDLE. THE SCREEN QUALITY IS EXCELLENT AND THE BACKLIT KEYBOARD MAKES IT SIMPLE TO OPERATE. I WISH I COULD SAY THE SAME THING ABOUT THE PIECE OF CRAP OPERATING SYSTEM CALLED WINDOWS 10....BUT THAT'S ANOTHER STORY.
customer_reviews.author: GMRA

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: The picture is terrible, it sounds like the speakers are underwater. It is also much slower than I would have expected.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Koskelowski

customer_reviews.title: Great for students
customer_reviews.text: I love this laptop. Viewing angles can be a little tricky but it isn't a problem if only one person is viewing. Great for college work, very fast boot up. I run games like Minecraft and undertale with ease. Overall, would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DesiRae

customer_reviews.title: Great Laptop.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent laptop. Lightning fast on start-up and changing from app to app or from different URL's. Screen is very clear and sharp and lightup keyboard is a plus. Does not have touch screen which was not important to me. I would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Kreig

customer_reviews.title: Screen gamma is off, haven't actually played any games on it.
customer_reviews.text: I like it, the size is nice the screen ratio is great. I added a 1TB ssd without any trouble. My first time upgrading a harddrive, kept the OS ssd and just added the 1TB for storage. Needed the ssd caddy though, which i didn't know before hand so I needed to wait nearly a week longer to be able to use it inside the computer.
customer_reviews.author: Jaron Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Best present ever!
customer_reviews.text: Ever since I started crafting with my cricut and doing embroidery with my sewing machine it was hard working on my phone to download things so my husband bought me this computer. It works great! Plus side my kids can’t get into it with the finger print scanner which works better then my phones finger scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Pinkluver89

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids online school
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to covid we had to buy this and we only use this for our kids online school stuff but it works great and services all his needs. I’m sure there are better options for gaming and/or other resource intensive applications like editing or artistry.
customer_reviews.author: BadKarma8049

customer_reviews.title: Screen started getting sketchy on day 4
customer_reviews.text: Worked great the first few days, but I was planning on already sending it back -- idk, just didn't really like it for some reason. Couldn't be more specific than aesthetic and the feel of the keyboard. However, today, the screen is starting to lose resolution, and gets all shaky and blurry. DEFINITELY sending back now.
customer_reviews.author: S. Uihlein

customer_reviews.title: Good laptop. Terrible audio.
customer_reviews.text: Screen is just okay, viewing angles are not the best. What really bothers me is the audio output- It’s next to terrible. Youtube and Netflix videos are almost unwatchable due to the low sound... even on max 100% volume. Buy this laptop if you need for basic internet browsing or home office. That’s it. Spend more if you need for audio/video editing.
customer_reviews.author: SJKLS

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited about this purchase but as soon as I turned it on I was disappointed. I tried it for a day or two in hopes of getting used to it but that did not happen. It seems like a great product for many reasons but the screen quality is terrible and I could not tolerate it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the price! ASUS - In Search of Incredible!
customer_reviews.text: I like the design of the product. Has a very nice thin look. I enjoy how light the laptop actually is. It’s easy to transport and fun to use. It runs games and gets the job done. Absolutely awesome! And, I love the backlit keys on the keyboard too!
customer_reviews.author: Preston Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Great value! Excellent for school.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well for the price. Great value, very lightweight, good battery, and smooth performance for internet and school applications. Keyboard and screen quality is basic but good overall. I didn't expect it perform as well as it does for the price I paid. Very satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Torres

customer_reviews.title: Can't install Linux
customer_reviews.text: This one sucks! There is no way to install Linux on it. Disabled Secure Boot, disabled fast boot, and even manually change the boot option in BIOS. Still won't boot from Linux Mint 20 USB stick. My other laptops, including even several ASUS from a couple of years ago, had no problem in booting into LInux from the same stick. So disappointed that ASUS even design such things that only work with Windows. Time to return and move on to something else ...
customer_reviews.author: souwolf

customer_reviews.title: Blue screen after 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Used for about two weeks already showing blue screens. Have not taken out of home or dropped it. Not sure why it is happening. Returning item
customer_reviews.author: AsJen

customer_reviews.title: Online Teaching!
customer_reviews.text: I love this computer. I teach students in China English via webcam. This works perfectly. I'm able to run the teaching platform I work for and multiple web pages simultaneously. I love the fingerprint scanner, it makes logging in so fast. The computer is also very light and has a sleek design. I love the back light on the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Make Sure you attach a wireless mouse!!
customer_reviews.text: This computer runs smoothly, has a nice big screen but the mouse part of it is very unstable. I almost threw it up against the wall because I was so frustrated that I couldn't exit out of tabs or easily click on links without it asking me if I wanted to "copy or paste"....if that makes sense. Never the less, I had to purchase a wireless mouse to go with this laptop. And the battery life is not that great. It runs out pretty fast
customer_reviews.author: brittany white

customer_reviews.title: ONLY WIFi. Cannot be hard wired
customer_reviews.text: Most disappointed in Asus. Some people like to have R 45. Option. No R45 Jack. Volume is soft.
customer_reviews.author: bushboy

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for a 2nd computer. Very nice feel to this laptop. I've had it for a week now and have had no issues. Easy to set up upon arrival. Battery does last quite a while and seems to charge quickly. Screen is clear. Great size and weight.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Donna Donna

customer_reviews.title: My budget
customer_reviews.text: I love the keyboard soft and silent back lit for those times when it is just enough light to keep getting it done. The speakers not so much. It is not a big fancy but I can see the world from my quarantined cave.
customer_reviews.author: B. C.

customer_reviews.title: Not much good
customer_reviews.text: I don't like Microsoft's Edge browser, and I have used the Chrome browser (or Firefox) instead. with previous versions of Windows 10. But I cannot do this with this machine, and I have tried many times. Also, the Date and Time are incorrect, and I cannot correct that either.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The battery life
customer_reviews.text: The product is great, I really liked it, but one thing that I'm concerned about is that the short lifespan of the battery, I tried using different methods to make it last longer, but all I got was to get it to 3 hrs, and that was using the battery saver and blocking apps. So, this is more like a question, but... How I can make it to last longer?
customer_reviews.author: samuel garcia

customer_reviews.title: Impressive!  Serious bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: Had my teenage daughter set it up. She hardly knows anything about computers and she had this thing running smoothly. Very happy with this laptop and I’m considering possibly getting one for myself. Well worth the asking price!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny &.

customer_reviews.title: Within the 1st 4-5 months the screen started going out.
customer_reviews.text: While working on files the screen randomly fades to white and a hard shutdown is needed and everything is lost. This happens every 1-2 weeks now. I will update this review if Asus helps and resolves the issue.
customer_reviews.author: momgifts

customer_reviews.title: Not 3.60 GHz & poor display
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this laptop based on the specs listing it as having a processing speed of 3.6 GHz. Upon starting up the laptop, I have noticed that it only runs at 1 GHz, less than half of my previous cpu speed. This is a dramatic difference and is noticed even with basic features being used so far. Definitely would not have purchased for only 1 GHz of processing speed. Also the monitor is very poor. It looks very sort of grainy or a grayish tiny to it.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Lions

customer_reviews.title: Great except for sound
customer_reviews.text: Only real con is for speaker quality. Other than that I'm happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: carol

product_meta.title: ASUS VivoBook 15 Thin and Light Laptop, 15.6” FHD Display, Intel i3-1005G1 CPU, 8GB RAM, 128GB SSD, Backlit Keyboard, Fingerprint, Windows 10 Home in S Mode, Slate Gray, F512JA-AS34
product_meta.description: Style:10th Gen Intel i3 CPUWhether at work or play, ASUS VivoBook 15 is the compact laptop that immerses you in whatever you set out to do. Its new frameless four-sided NanoEdge display boasts an ultraslim 5.7mm bezel, giving an amazing 88% screen-to-body ratio for supremely immersive visuals. The ErgoLift hinge design also tilts the keyboard up for more comfortable typing. VivoBook 15 is powered by an Intel core i3 processor to help you get things done with the least amount of fuss. *The actual transfer speed of USB 3.0, 3.1, 3.2 (Gen 1 and 2), and/or Type-C will vary depending on many factors including the processing speed of the host device, file attributes and other factors related to system configuration and your operating environment.
feature_bullets: 15.6 inch Full HD (1920x1080) 4-way NanoEdge bezel display with a stunning 88% screen-to-body ratio
Latest 10th Gen Intel Core i3-1005G1 CPU (4M Cache, up to 3.4 GHz)
8GB DDR4 RAM and 128GB PCIe NVMe M.2 SSD
Ergonomic backlit keyboard with fingerprint sensor activated via windows hello
Exclusive Ergolift design for an improved typing position
Comprehensive connections including USB 3.2 Type-C, USB 3.2 Type-A, USB 2.0, and HDMI; Gigabit Wi-Fi 5 (802.11ac) (*USB Transfer speed may vary. Learn more at ASUS website)

Windows 10 in S mode exclusively runs apps from the Microsoft Store. To install an app that isn't available in the Microsoft Store, simply switch out of S mode in three easy steps. There's no charge to switch out of S mode

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,418 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
